text: Hello. can I create custom object and schema with free account?
No unfortunately at this time custom objects are restricted to enterprise
can you please help me to integrate with my project
My project is laravel based web application
And what are you trying to integrate with this laravel project?
CRM like if create user from my web then it will also create in HubSpot contact
everything which is created from my website also create in HubSpot. If anything is not suited then custom objects created
But unfortunately you can't use custom objects on free accounts, also if you're looking to hire someone to help you with this project I would suggest posting in the <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> channel
No i don't want to hire

Hey all, does the onFormSubmitted global event not work with an event listener, or am I just doing something wrong? I'm using JS to grab some data from a form submission and redirect to a certain page accordingly, but I'm running to some submissions not being captured using the onFormSubmit, especially on mobile devices, I'm assuming because of connection issues. I tried to workaround this using a setTimeout, but still running into some issues (albeit less). Is is possible to use onFormSubmitted instead of onFormSubmit for an embedded form on a HubSpot page? Code threaded below. *(Solved â€“ threaded reply)*

`<script>`
 `window.addEventListener('message', event => {`
  `if(event.data.type === 'hsFormCallback' && event.data.eventName === 'onFormSubmit') {`
	`var email;`
    `var status;`
    `for (item in event.data.data) {`
      `if (event.data.data[item]["name"] == "email") {`
        `email = event.data.data[item]["value"];`
      `}`
      `if (event.data.data[item]["name"] == "fellows_app_current_admit_me_status") {`
        `if (event.data.data[item]["value"] != "None of the above") {`
          `status = event.data.data[item]["value"];`
          `console.log(status); // Debugging Purposes Only`
          `setTimeout(() => {`
           `window.location.href = "<https://resources.admit.me/fellows-application-part-2?email=>" + email + "&fellows_app_current_admit_me_status=" + status;`
          `}, 500)`

        `}`
      `}`
      `}`

  `}`
`});`
`</script>`
This works perfectly fine in terms of execution, but when I swap out onFormSubmit with onFormSubmitted, nothing works.

For anyone curious, I actually managed to figure this out. Had to put the actual grabbing of the data and the redirect in two separate portions. Ended up looking like this:

`<script>`
  `var email;`
  `var status;`
 `window.addEventListener('message', event => {`

  `if(event.data.type === 'hsFormCallback' && event.data.eventName === 'onFormSubmit') {`
    `for (item in event.data.data) {`
      `if (event.data.data[item]["name"] == "email") {`
        `email = event.data.data[item]["value"];`
      `}`
      `if (event.data.data[item]["name"] == "fellows_app_current_admit_me_status") {`
          `status = event.data.data[item]["value"];`
        `console.log(status); // Debugging Purposes Only`
      `}`
    `}`

  `}`
   `if(event.data.type === 'hsFormCallback' && event.data.eventName === 'onFormSubmitted') {`
     `if(status != "None of the above") {`
      `window.location.href = "<https://resources.admit.me/fellows-application-part-2?email=>" + email + "&fellows_app_current_admit_me_status=" + status;`     
    `}`
   `}`
`});`
`</script>`
